fields.description:
It seems that sometimes some pages do not get indexed by Confluence.  It seems a bit random.  Symptom is like: Say, I have a page called "confluence training", and it has an attachment called "confluence training.ppt", and I type in "confluence training" into search box, the ppt file is the only one found.  In other cases, I could type in something in title or page body, and not find that page at all.  Reindexing doesn't even help.  And then I add in a sentence to that page, which triggered an indexing event on a maybe fresh page now (?), and that page now appears in the search result!

It's very strange and it happens to maybe 10% of random pages (the page content should not be the issue 'cause one could make trivial update on the page and get that page indexed).  It's obvious that it was an indexing problem and reindex for some reason doesn't help.  Any idea why that happens?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Cannot find some pages that I know exist in spaces

fields.summary: System error when trying to set permissions for a space

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to assign permissions for a blog entry.  There are some blog entries that are meant for your team and others that are meant for any user of the system.  By extending the permissions being used in the wiki pages to the blog\news, you could allow for this multiuse of the blog section within a single space.  You have to create 2 seperate spaces right now to perform the same feature and if a blog is meant for both audiences, then it has to be posted twice.
fields.summary: Permissioning individual Blog Entry

fields.description: It would be nice is a user could click on a button that would save what they are writting as a draft.  Some times you get half way through a nEws\blog post and you have stop typing.  You don't want to hit save and would like to hit  "Save for Later" or "Save as Draft".  This feature would also extend to wikis like used in wikipedia..
fields.summary: User Savable Drafts

fields.description:
In our company we use Mediawiki as documentation platform.
Now we would like to switch to Confluence.
Is there any way to import Mediawiki- data/attachment/user to confluence?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5740].
  {panel}

Guy Fraser on conf-user:

Yup, the somewhat odd "Advanced" tab. Everything about that tab seems a little odd - it's almost like an "Other Stuff that doesn't quite fit anywhere else so we had to stick it here" tab.

Could a "watch space" icon be placed on the spaces list? So just as you can click the star to add the space to your favourites, you could click an envelope to watch the space.

The orphaned / undefined pages could possibly go to the Browse Space > Pages tab?

With what's left could the "Advanced" tab then be renamed to "Export" or something similar?
fields.summary: Improve Advanced tab in Browse Space

fields.description: External links can not be inserted in the WYSIWYG editor. After entering the details into the popup window and clicking OK (or Cancel) nothing happens. JavaScript console reports Ok() not found.
fields.summary: Create external link in WYSIWYG does not work

fields.description:
getUsersWithConfluenceAccess() is pure evil. With any reasonably-sized userbase, It grinds even the most helpful server to a halt.

Currently it's called from three or four different places:

1) License check
2) Adding a new user
3) Whenever the license check cache expires

We should find alternatives, and ensure that the method is never called for anything but the license check when:

1) External user management is enabled
2) select count\(*) from users > 1000

We should also just disable the license check entirely for unlimited-user licenses (i.e. 10,000 user licenses or more). Right now this limits our ability to offer licensing schemes >10,000 users per license, but tough, this is hurting us now. :)
fields.summary: getUsersWithConfluenceAccess() is very slow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5728].
  {panel}

Currently the addition of a child page does not trigger a page-change notification to people subscribed to the parent.  It would be nice if this could be considered worthy of notification.

* A new page version is not needed, but a special "Child added to page" mail would/could be nice.
* Only the addition of direct child pages should cause a notification to avoid notification insanity.
* Something like this might be a good user option to add - "Consider creation of direct child-pages worthy of change notification"
fields.summary: Make adding a child page trigger an e-mail to people subscribed to the parent
Enhance {vote} macro to track voters' information

fields.description: Character "+" is removed from task name in dynamic tasklist. If a task with the name "a+b" is added, the name "a b" is displayed.
fields.summary: Character "+" is removed from the task name in dynamic tasklist.

fields.description: It would be nice if the Remote API supported version comment and minor revision when creating or editing pages remotely.
fields.summary: Ability to flag page updates as a "minor revision" in the Remote API

fields.description: The problem is in GlobalHelper choosing the space, because CreatePage*Action don't extend any of the classes in getSpace() method.
fields.summary: Create page doesn't use space logo

fields.description:
Our group membership search doesn't pick up users in some LDAP configurations, most notably Active Directory. In AD, a user record and corresponding group record might look like this:

cn=jsmith,cn=Users,dc=example,dc=com
cn: jsmith
objectClass: inetOrgPerson
sAMAccountName: john

cn=confluence-users,cn=Groups,dc=example,dc=com
cn: confluence-users
objectClass: group
member: cn=jsmith,cn=Users,dc=example,dc=com

Confluence assumes incorrectly that the group membership for John Smith would be: smAccountName=john,cn=Users,dc=example,dc=com. Oops.

We should decouple the attribute used for the login name from the group search filter.
fields.summary: Group membership search in LDAP assumes user's dn starts with username attribute
resin or confluence's bug in non-ascii attachment file download

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5721].
  {panel}

A customer has requested the ability to have a user profile search screen which allows one to search across the fields of a user profile including any custom fields that may be added if the custom user profile feature is added to Confluence.

This screen would list all fields that one could search across and include multi-select lists for any drop down menu options that may be included in any custom user profiles.

This way users could search for other users based on variables such as:

 - name
 - region (country/state/city)
 - industry
 - interests

This would be great for community based sites (helping people find and connect with others) which is a a great use cases for wikis.
fields.summary: Create user profile search screen - include support for customised user profiles

fields.description: I find that I have to drive people to use Confluence. It would be a real help if I could automatically assign all members of a space to receive News items as email notifications.
fields.summary: ability to assign users/groups as watchers/subscribers for news.

fields.description:
Includes two issues:
- Extension of group search to include local/Primary Repository groups.
- How to remove/manage users from local/Primary Repository database while external/LDAP user management is in effect.
fields.summary: Users cannot be added or removed from local groups when LDAP user management is enabled

fields.description:
In the description of the {recently-used} macro the description for spaces and labels are in one item:
* spaces - (optional) comma separated list of space keys labels - (optional) comma separated list of labels (content associated with at least one of these will be listed)

should be
* spaces - (optional) comma separated list of space keys
* labels - (optional) comma separated list of labels (content associated with at least one of these will be listed)
fields.summary: Notation-Guide: Missing item in {recently-updated} description

fields.description:
A customer has requested that we build a fully functional table of contents generator. Creating the issue in Atlassian's jira.atlassian.com to track popularity.

There is a plugin built by a third party that is attempting this, there are issues with the linking in this issue. You can vote for the external plugin to be fixed here:

http://jira.nextgencoder.com/browse/TOC-12
fields.summary: Build fully functional table of contents macro

fields.description: I'd like to be able to subscribe to an RSS feed to the News for a given space.  Alternatively (or in addition), I'd like to be able to watch the News for a given space and be e-mailed whenever a new item gets posted.
fields.summary: Make News more blog-like

fields.description:
When using the WYSIWYG editor and editing a page, if a user clicks "Insert/Edit Image", the "Image Properties" popup window is displayed. If there are too many attachments, the "ok" and "cancel" buttons at the bottom of the page can no longer be seen.

In Mozilla Firefox, the user can scroll down using the mouse's scroll wheel or the up/down buttons on the keyboard - however when using Internet Explorer this is not possible.

In Internet Explorer: currently the only way to make the 'ok' and 'cancel' buttons visible is to click on a blank space within the popup, and drag the mouse downward whilst holding the mouse button down - effectively "highlighting" the contents. This will make the button visible and thus usable.
fields.summary: When inserting image onto a page via WYSIWIG Editor -> "Insert/Edit Image" icon, the "ok" and "cancel" buttons are no longer visible when there are too many image attachments

fields.description:
over time all content becomes stale. a big improvement in content management would be to tag all pages with an owner and a "next review" date, and build a simple workflow around it.

this would probably be a site or space option because not everybody might want it.

we could have a simple filter capability where each page would be displayed below a navbar that would allow the content owner to page back and forth between items (similar to a browsing a JIRA search result set) among the pages marked "stale" or whose "next review" date is today or in the past. they could easily update the page content and/or manually or automatically set the next review date. or they could skip the page and leave it marked stale for another time.

one extended permission would be to allow users to tag pages that they came across and suspected as being stale with a simple AJAX icon such as the favourite star. this would have to be a permission, as it could be abused.
fields.summary: freshness date

fields.description:
With Confluence 2.1 and previous versions, we have seen a repeatable problem where interactive backups started via the web interface never complete.  One attempt to backup has been running for approximately 6 days.  During this time, the CPU has been maxed at nearly 100% utilization.  The JVM has been allocated a maximum heap of nearly 2GB.

The odd thing is that scheduled backups complete perfectly, and do such in a timely manner with lower levels of memory.

This problem seems isolated to large data sets, such as those at docs.codehaus.org and wiki.opensymhony.com.  If you would like, I can provide one of the daily backup for testing.
fields.summary: Interactive Backups Never Complete (Scheduled Backups Work)
Add horizontal scroll bar to wiki markup editor

fields.description:
When splitting up an article with a lot of incoming links into different articles, some of these links must be rewritten to the new articles. A nice feature would be:

- to allow the space admin to search for a link (probably with anchor) 
- present the articles and an excerpt where the link was found
- let the space admin choose the articles to be changed (check box, Button to mark/unmark all)
- "replace with" text box (like the "parent page" field under the edit article function) with lookup function and plausibility check (e.g. does the article in "replace with" exists?)

... or something similar
fields.summary: Search and replace function for links in articles (to be used by space admins)
Comments tab under the "Browse Space" page
RSS/Atom display of updated entries

fields.description:
I wanted to insert { in monospace font using {{ and }}.

There are really interesting outputs depending on various combinations on line. :-)
"{{\{}}" produces "{{{}}"
"{{\{}} and {{\}}}" produces "} and {"
fields.summary: I can't insert typewriter/monospace {

fields.description:
This problem was fixed in the AbstractHttpRetrievalMacro (for v1 macros) in 2.0 (CONF-4006), but not in BaseHttpRetrievalMacro (for v2 macros). It should be simple to port this across.

For information on this property, see: http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/guide/net/properties.html
fields.summary: RSS macro ignores 'nonProxyHosts' JVM property

fields.description:
In Opera 8.5, the rich text editor isn't loaded and the dynamic page preview doesn't work (preview still operates via form submission).

This is probably related to our Javascript checking or one of the dependencies not supporting Opera (scriptaculous, prototype or tinymce).
fields.summary: Make rich text editor and dynamic preview work in Opera

fields.description: When adding a new comment to a Confluence page, the image button is missing from the toolbar in the rich text editor. This button is shown in the wiki markup toolbar. This button is also shown in the toolbar of the rich text editor in the reply comment.

Apparently a lot of performance enhancements in more recent versions. It's available for download from:

http://www.suigeneris.org/kb/display/jrcs/Home#Home-Download

Note that package names have changed in 0.3, as the author has removed it from the Jakarta Commons.
fields.summary: Update version of JRCS used in Confluence (diff tool)

fields.description:
For some users using the AtlassianUser LDAP integration, they get an error after this seqeuence of actions: 

a) click on the group picker for setting page level security (create or edit page) 
b) select a valid group from the list
c) then save the page
fields.summary: Unknown Group error on setting page level permission
Use PagePicker instead of select box on edit space screen
Section headers for left bar navigation should be fully clickable
Borders on {section} tags should collapse

fields.description:
We are evaluating Confluence. After upgrade from version 2.1.3 to version 2.1.4 we are not able to preview edited content. Attached stacktrace appears in logs. 
I was not using WYSIWYG editor and I haven't check whether it is also not functional.
Downgrading back to 2.1.3 solved the problem.
fields.summary: preview in editor is not functional

fields.description:
It would be helpful if the children macro would also allow to filter by specified labels:

Example: 
{children:labels=mylabel1,mylabel2} 

Returns all children of the current page with at least one of the specified labels.
fields.summary: {children} should allow filtering by lable

fields.description: When using the Jira Issues macro with |count=true the number of issues is incorrect. The macro consistently adds 4 to the total. See http://docs.codehaus.org/display/MULE/Status for an example
fields.summary: Jira Issues macro seems to add 4 issues when using the 'count' argument

fields.description:
Example: 

!http://clifford.pixar.com/templar/preview?id=50553528&height=480!

Returns a JPEG image with the headers:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Wed, 08 Mar 2006 18:11:12 GMT
Server: Apache/2.2.0 (Unix)
Connection: close
Content-Length: 37534
Content-Type: image/jpeg

The embedded resource parser incorrectly guesses the content type as 'application/octet-stream' based on the filename 'preview'. Confluence is then unable to render it.

When the filename guessing provides no useful content type for external resources, the parser should check the content-type HTTP header.
fields.summary: Content type guessing for external embedded resources doesn't use the Content-type HTTP header
Escaping of character style modifiers is too conservative

fields.description: Appears that we need to add "Individual Users" permission to "Space Admin" to allow that person to "add new space template", versus having that person in a group that has "Space Admin" permission.  Note that we have confluence using the Jira user management.
fields.summary: Create templates does not work with "group" space administrator

fields.description: I really need to be able to set page permissions at both the user and group level.  At the moment, it appears in the user interface that you only support Groups or user:ME.  Is there any way to do this?  If not, please could you implement it as it means that we can start offering personalised pages on the wiki.
fields.summary: User level permission on pages

fields.description:
When creating pages I add links to attachments. When I go back in and edit the page the attachment links break even though I didn't touch them. Reviewing the code I see that the carrot ^ has disappeared from the front of the filename. 

This happens as the page edit opens directly tothe Rich text editor and it removes the ^ from the formatting. But if I add it with the WikiMarkup page and save the page, the page would be fine till next edit.

Every time you open the page for editing this happens.
fields.summary: Links to attachments break when page re-edited

fields.description: A nice admin feature would be a report that checks all the links in a space, both internal and external, and gives infromation about their status, eg OK or broke, or 404,500 or DNS not found etc.
fields.summary: Broken link report

fields.description: For a Confluence LDAP integration setup (using Atlassian-User), you cannot login with accounts set up in the local or hibernate repository if the LDAP or Active Directory server is down.
fields.summary: Local user accounts cannot login if LDAP or Active Directory server is down

fields.description:
If RTE is standard editor, or when you do a round trip between rte and markup:
- Copy/create page with anchor link ([#anchor])
-> Page contains a corrupted anchor link ([##anchor] instead of [#anchor])
fields.summary: corrupted anchor link on round trip in create or copy page

fields.description: User gets javascript errors about server not available when switching between rich edit and wiki text mode.
fields.summary: Javascript exception NS_ERROR_NOT_AVAILABLE when changing editor tabs in Firefox
LinkManager.getIncomingLinksToContent should return links found in comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5672].
  {panel}

Currently, there are a bunch of things that are global options that would make more sense at the space level, including but not limited to:

* CamelCase linking
* Trackback
* Threaded comments
* Rich Text Editor prefs
* Maximum attachment size
* Macro availability

In each case, the global setting should be considered the default. Additionally global administrators should be able to 'lock' a setting so it can not be overridden -- use the mnemonic of an open or closed padlock next to the setting? (For the "attachment size" setting, the lock should mean that the size setting can't be exceeded, but maybe space admins can still set a lower size?)
fields.summary: Move global configuration options to the space level where relevant

fields.description:
I have www.telscenter.org/confluence[1] operating as a proxy for tels-group.soe.berkeley.edu:9006/confluence[2], which is a Tomcat appserver.  Here's the relevant snip of httpd.conf:
# Atlassian Confluence
ProxyPass               /confluence/       http://tels-group.soe.berkeley.edu:9006/confluence/
ProxyPassReverse        /confluence/       http://tels-group.soe.berkeley.edu:9006/confluence/

I go to [1] and log in.  It succeeds but redirects me to [2].  I can return to [1] and I will be logged in, but my users don't know to do this.  I've recorded the HTTP session and I see that Confluence is redirecting on successful login, which makes sense, but I would expect to observe my "Server Base URL" configuration which is "http://www.telscenter.org/confluence/".

FWIW, changing "Site Homepage" has no effect.  Incidentally, when I choose "dashboard" the option shows up blank.

Attached is the capture from Firefox's "Live HTTP headers" extension.
fields.summary: After login, redirecting to appserver's URL instead of Server Base URL

fields.description: It would be great to have the possibility to download all the attachments from a specific space in order to do some work off-line.
fields.summary: Download all attachments from a Space

fields.description: Comment times don't make sense -- looks like they're being set by the browser (in different time zones).  See attached screenshot, where a preceeding comment has a timestamp later than the following one.
fields.summary: Comment times should be set by server and display timezone

fields.description:
What is this little box thing that shows up in the edit comment box when I add a comment at confluence.atlassian.com? It starts out as some ampersand-prefixed something or another, then turns into a little box with numbers in it in the WYSIWYG editor.

Here's a cut-and-paste (don't know if this will show up):   

Attached is a screenshot, in case the cut-and-paste doesn't show up.
fields.summary: Funky little box in comment editor

The link should be:

http://confluence-instance/label/SPACE/team:mylabel

But it is just:

http://confluence-instance/label/SPACE/mylabel
fields.summary: On edit space labels page, clicking on team labels doesn't work

fields.description:
If you have a multi line paragraph and select part of it, then format as a heading, the entire paragraph gets formatted.

This was observed in a pasted in email, Firefox, OS X
fields.summary: Can't format part of a paragraph

fields.description:
Go to Space Admin page, 'Edit Space Labels'.

Add label: 'foo bar', hit enter. Nothing happens.
fields.summary: Can't create multiple space labels on space admin

fields.description:
Right now you can submit a new page or edits to an existing page with ALT-s. It would be nice to be able to use the same method when commenting on a page.

See CONF-5557 for a bit more discussion.
fields.summary: make ALT+s submit the comment form

fields.description:
Editing very long documents suck, because a) you're stuck in this small textarea and b) there's no ctrl-F find. So I normally copy the entire body of the document, paste into BBEdit, make my changes using BBEdit's tools, and then paste back to save to Confluence.

However, that's not really something you can tell customers to do. However, it would help a great deal if we could provide search functionality within the text area. I think it should override ctrl-F. Functionally, it should auto-scroll the text area to the next occurence of the string, and possibly highlight the word. (Don't know if this last is really possible. May not be.)
fields.summary: Provide a 'Find'  feature for wiki-markup editing

fields.description:
After I changed the settings in server.xml by replacing port 8080 by port 80 the notification email we get from the system still point to URL with port 8080.

So the users cannot get to the documents by clicking on the links from the emails.
fields.summary: Links from notification emails point to port 8080 despite the server.xml has been changed to use port 80

fields.description:
When i create a link to an attachment in "Wiki Editor", it was display correctly.
If i use the "Rich Text Editor", it delete the ^-Sign and a page link was displayed.

If this bug is not fixed, we won't buy confluence.
fields.summary: attachment link is incorrect...

fields.description:
In page setup/setupstandarddb.action is pressent: Configuring the database failed. Couldnt create the database schema.

Error: Couldnt in second sentence.

fields.description: In rich text editing mode, it is possible for the user to scale an image that is inserted into a Confluence page. Image scaling is not supported in Confluence and this fucntionality in the editor should be removed.
fields.summary: Image scaling in Rich Text (WYSIWYG) Editing Mode

fields.description:
When adding a new macro through the RTE, all pipes (|) are escaped. 

For example:

{toc:type=flat|separator=pipe|maxLevel=2}

becomes

{toc:type=flat\|separator=pipe\|maxLevel=2}

This bug does NOT:
# Escape existing macros on pages
# Escape macros added through wiki markup

This is because, when a macro is initially added it is parsed by the renderer as text rather than as a macro (it needs to be surrounded by a macro div).
fields.summary: Adding macros with attributes using separators (|) in rich text (WYSIWYG) breaks

fields.description: Pages named as "."  or "....", etc can not be accessed in Confluence. Confluence should prevent users from creating pages with such titles.
fields.summary: Page titles with a period '.' breaks

fields.description:
Importing mail from a space export doesn't set the 'From' address, so all mail is shown as from 'Anonymous'.

Subsequent mails received through the same account do get the address added correctly.

Screenshots from original report at https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-2797.
fields.summary: Space import doesn't set mail 'From' address

fields.description:
A customer has requested the ability to add groups within groups. 

Currently only a single level of groups exists within Confluence's user management.
fields.summary: Extend user management to allow groups within groups

fields.description:
If the image size can't be read, these attributes should be omitted, so the browser autodetects the size. Otherwise the browser doesn't display the image.

fields.description:
The "Export Space" function with "Export Format" in "HTML Output" doesn't considering the creation of case-sensitive links.

E.g.:
- the page http://wiki.opensymphony.com/display/CACHE/Installation+Guide contains the sentence "Read the requirements for more details."
- the link http://wiki.opensymphony.com/display/CACHE/Requirements is created via "Read the [requirements] for more details."
- the html export of the Installation Guide will contain the link "requirements.html" (small letter), but the export will contain the file "Requirements.html" (capital letter)
- if the exported files are stored on a case-sensitive OS the links will be broken
fields.summary: Incorrect html links in Export Space
